posts.post_content:
The back story on these is that 80 hand-cut Polar Bears recently showed up at auction.  To my knowledge, these are the first Polar Bear Printer's Scrap cards that have been found.  A friend bought 44 of them, and I bought them from him.  I tried to fit them back together like a puzzle.  Unfortunately, I wasn't able to.  As a result, I feel less need to keep them together, so I'm not going to keep them all.

The first scans are cards for sale, and the others are pics of the group of 80 as a whole.

Shipping is $3 regardless of how many you want

Kroh $58 SOLD

First group of 8 is almost gone.  Bump to add a few more:
Adding a few of the others:
That's a good looking group of Hand Cut PB's !! Jantz would of loved these cards !!

yes I agree....

JANTZ was the man!
Luke- put me down for one. Dibs on the one with the most wonky edges, you pick.

"I tried to fit them back together like a puzzle. Unfortunately, I wasn't able to."

Luke- did any of them fit together (i.e. cut from the same sheet)?
A couple of the duplicates seemed to fit together.  The Raymonds looked like they were one on top of the other for example.  I have a picture somewhere on my phone I think.

I will take the Krause portrait.
Thank you.
Hank
do I see a Krause freak run developing????:D
